pages.title: Prisma Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce the Prisma monorepo, explaining its purpose as a next-generation ORM for Node.js and TypeScript, and providing a high-level overview of its architecture and key components

pages.title: Monorepo Architecture
pages.purpose: Detail the monorepo structure, explaining the pnpm workspace setup, core packages (@prisma/client, @prisma/cli, @prisma/migrate, @prisma/engines, etc.), their dependencies, and how they work together

pages.title: Core Concepts and Getting Started
pages.purpose: Explain fundamental Prisma concepts including the Prisma schema, data models, generators, datasources, and provide guidance on getting started with Prisma Client

pages.title: Prisma Client System
pages.purpose: Comprehensive overview of the Prisma Client system, covering its initialization, runtime architecture, and how it provides type-safe database access

pages.title: Client Generation Pipeline
pages.purpose: Explain how Prisma Client code is generated from the schema, including the role of generators (prisma-client-ts, prisma-client-js), DMMF processing, and file generation

pages.title: Build System and WASM Integration
pages.purpose: Detail the esbuild-based build pipeline, how it creates multiple runtime bundles (Node.js, browser, edge), and the WebAssembly integration strategy including base64 encoding for edge runtimes

pages.title: DMMF and Type System
pages.purpose: Explain the Data Model Meta Format (DMMF), how it represents the Prisma schema, and how TypeScript types are generated to provide compile-time type safety

pages.title: Client Runtime and Request Handling
pages.purpose: Describe the PrismaClient runtime architecture, including request handling, batching via DataLoader, middleware system, and transaction management

pages.title: Query Execution and Engine Integration
pages.purpose: Explain how queries are compiled and executed, covering the ClientEngine, query compilation via WASM, and the executor abstraction (LocalExecutor vs RemoteExecutor)

pages.title: Driver Adapter System
pages.purpose: Document the driver adapter architecture that enables Prisma to work with various database drivers (pg, neon, planetscale, libsql, d1, etc.) and runtime environments

pages.title: Extension System
pages.purpose: Explain the Prisma Client extension mechanism ($extends, defineExtension) that allows customization of client behavior, model methods, result transformations, and query interception

pages.title: Prisma CLI
pages.purpose: Overview of the Prisma command-line interface, its commands, and how it orchestrates schema management, code generation, and database operations

pages.title: Generate Command
pages.purpose: Detail the 'prisma generate' command, including how it discovers and executes generators, handles watch mode, and generates TypedSQL modules

pages.title: Init Command and Platform Integration
pages.purpose: Explain the 'prisma init' command for project setup, and the Prisma Data Platform authentication system including OAuth login flow and Management API integration

pages.title: Migration System
pages.purpose: Document all migration-related CLI commands (migrate dev, migrate deploy, migrate status, db push, db pull, migrate diff, migrate resolve) and the underlying Migrate class orchestration

pages.title: Development and Testing
pages.purpose: Overview of the development workflow, testing infrastructure, and continuous integration systems that maintain code quality in the Prisma monorepo

pages.title: Testing Infrastructure
pages.purpose: Detail the functional testing framework, including matrix-based test suite generation, environment setup, driver adapter testing, and the run-tests.ts CLI wrapper

pages.title: CI/CD and Release Pipeline
pages.purpose: Explain the GitHub Actions workflows for testing, custom engine builds, and the publishing pipeline including version calculation, topological sorting, and multi-channel releases
